result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jesus E Galvan-Peralta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant.
  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Plea questionnaire filed.  
State's offer and recommendation:   Plea to count 1, hit/run; counts 2 and 3 will be dismissed.  Counts 2 and 3  may be reissued as municipal citation.  State cannot meet burden on counts 2,3.  Recommend 9 mos RCJ on hit/run charge.
15CF1734:  Plea to count 2; d/ri count 1.  Follow recommendation of PSI
Court colloquy re rights being waived, elements of charges and possible penalties.
PLEA - guilty each of 2 counts
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, intellingently and voluntarily

PSI ordered

BTC: Modify bond to $500.00 cash. All terms and conditions as previously ordered remain. DO NOT DRIVE W/O VALID LICENSE AND VALID INSURANCE

NG plea entered.

Defendant Jesus E Galvan-Peralta in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Interpreter:  Alberto Aguilar.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-14-2016 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Do not drive at all.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
